definition: to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
(archaic) sentence-final particle expressing a doubting attitude
to reside/to be (in a certain position)/to store up/to be at a standstill/residence/house/restaurant/classifier for bedrooms
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: I've been insecurely housed for three years now.
sentences.chinese: 像這樣居無定所的日子我已過了三年了。

sentences.english: Most of Indians of the North American plains are nomadic.
sentences.chinese: 北美平原上的印地安人大多居無定所。

sentences.english: Most of the Indians of the North American plains are nomadic.
sentences.chinese: 北美平原上的印地安人大多居無定所。

sentences.english: You come from an itinerant family.
sentences.chinese: 你出身於一個居無定所的家庭。

definition: to take a risk out of desperation (idiom)
every hope turns to dust (idiom); completely disheartened
to see, hear and obey (idiom); to take advice/to take sb at his word
to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
